required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Bone Toxicity Following Pelvic Radiotherapy: A Prospective Randomised Controlled Feasibility Study Evaluating a Musculoskeletal Health Package in Women With Gynaecological Cancers Undergoing Pelvic Radiotherapy

brief_summary.textblock: A randomised controlled clinical feasibility trial to determine the feasibility and acceptability of a "musculoskeletal health package (MHP)" intervention in women undergoing pelvic radiotherapy for gynaecological malignancies and inform power calculations for a definitive trial.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Patients will be randomly assigned to either an observational arm or an interventional arm consisting of a musculoskeletal health package

primary_outcome.description: proportion of patients eligible for the study from the patient population

primary_outcome.measure: Recruitment and study group allocation rate
primary_outcome.description: number of eligible patients recruited, randomised and allocated to appropriate study populations

secondary_outcome.measure: Longitudinal change in BMD
secondary_outcome.description: BMD measured by DXA at baseline and 18 months

secondary_outcome.description: FRAX assessment tool (including femoral neck BMD)

Quality of Life Assessment : adapted CTCAE pelvic questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: CTCAE pelvic questionnaire, (common terminology criteria for adverse events). (measures: Bowel questions scored out of 22, urinary questions out of 19 and sexual questions out of 8. Total out of 49: higher score = worse quality of life)

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of Life Assessment: SMFA adapted to lower limbs
secondary_outcome.description: adapted SMFA : short form musculoskeletal function assessment (scores are standardised with high scores indicating poor function. 39 questions min score possible 39, max score possible 195 (raw scores)

arm_group.description: No intervention. Standard of care cancer pathway followed.

3 month prehabilitation exercise program during radiotherapy and assessment of BMD at baseline with appropriate management according to fracture risk assessment (with either (a) lifestyle advice, (b) calcium and vitamin D (c) calcium, vitamin D and bisphosphonate (alendronate))

intervention.description: 3 month prehabilitation exercise program during radiotherapy with assessment of BMD at baseline with appropriate management according to fracture risk assessment (with either (a) lifestyle advice, (b) calcium and vitamin D (c) calcium, vitamin D and bisphosphonate (alendronate))

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age over 18 years
- histologically confirmed uterine or cervix cancer
- patients undergoing potentially curative/adjuvant radiotherapy
- ability to give informed consent to participate
Exclusion Criteria:
- age less than 18 years or greater than 85 years
- patients with pre-existing bone conditions such as: osteoporosis treated with bisphosphonates in the previous 5 years/fibrous dysplasia/osteogenesis imperfecta or other metabolic bone condition
- inability to give informed consent to participate
- home address outside Greater Manchester
- contraindication or intolerance of Magnetic Resonance scanning

eligibility.gender_description: Gynae-oncology patients with cervical or endometrial cancer
